intro: Centaurea goksivriensis, commonly known as the Goksivri thistle, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, bristly stems and bright purple to pink flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showing adaptations to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. Centaurea goksivriensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
